basics.name: Kinjalk Parth
basics.summary: I work in Dr. Andrew Leakey's lab at the Carl R. Woese Institute for Genomic Biology (UIUC) on computer vision for plant biology: quantifying plant traits and building software to help plant biologists navigate a data-rich world. ICLR 2026 Oral. M.C.S. (UIUC, 3.93/4.00). B.Tech CSE AI/ML (SRM IST).

work.company: Leakey Lab, Carl R. Woese Institute for Genomic Biology, University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign
work.summary: Using computer vision to solve problems in plant biology: trait quantification, phenotyping, and software solutions to help plant biologists navigate increased data.
highlights: Computer vision for plant phenotyping and trait quantification
Software tools for data-driven plant biology
Deep learning for root and minirhizotron image analysis

education.institution: SRM Institute of Science and Technology

skills.name: Certifications
keywords: Image Classification with CNNs using Keras (Coursera)

references.name: Satyam Tiwari
references.reference: I wholeheartedly recommend Kinjalk for their outstanding expertise in data science and AI. Their deep understanding of advanced analytics, machine learning, and programming languages like Python and R, combined with their passion for continuous learning, make them an exceptional asset.

references.name: Ishan Gautam
references.reference: Kinjal worked for me on an AI Project. I was profoundly impressed with his deep knowledge of AI and ML despite being straight out of college. He communicated most effectively and had a knack for problem-solving. His grit and smile are unwavering.

publications.name: Can you spot the AI peer reviewer? (ICLR 2026 Oral)
publications.summary: Work on AI in peer review, selected as ICLR 2026 Oral (~top 1%). With Shubham Ugare and Sasa Misailovic.

publications.name: RootQuant: Automated Root Trait Quantification from Minirhizotron Images Using Deep Learning
publications.summary: Deep learning (Inception-ResNet-v2) for automated root length and area prediction from minirhizotron images; R² = 0.903 (length), 0.880 (area) on soybean and maize DRIFACE data. Fast-forward talk and poster at NAPPN 2026.

publications.name: RootSAM: Adapting SAM2.1 for Root Segmentation in Minirhizotron Imagery
publications.summary: Adapting Segment Anything Model (SAM2.1) for root segmentation in minirhizotron imagery. With Sebastian Quintela, Andrew Leakey, Sam Walker, Nadia Shakoor. Lightning talk EA #19 at CVPPA 2025.

publications.name: SPROUTS: An Integrated Desktop Application for High-Throughput Root Phenotyping
publications.summary: Integrated desktop application for high-throughput root phenotyping. With Sebastian Quintela and Andrew Leakey. Lightning talk EA #7 at CVPPA 2025.

presentations.name: Can you spot the AI peer reviewer? (ICLR 2026 Oral)
presentations.description: Oral presentation (~top 1% selection). With Shubham Ugare and Sasa Misailovic.

presentations.name: RootQuant: Automated Root Trait Quantification from Minirhizotron Images Using Deep Learning
RootSAM: Adapting SAM2.1 for Root Segmentation in Minirhizotron Imagery
SPROUTS: An Integrated Desktop Application for High-Throughput Root Phenotyping
